Description: The FHIR Goal resource defines desired health outcomes to be achieved by a patient over a period of time such as "lower blood pressure in the next three months" or "Lose 10 lbs by X date".
SampleResponse:
<Goal xmlns="http://hl7.org/fhir">

<status value="achieved" />

<category>

<coding>

<system value="urn:oid:1.2.840.114350.1.13.861.1.7.4.737184.20005" />

<code value="3" />

<display value="Weight" />

</coding>

<text value="Weight" />

</category>

<description>

<text value="Weight < 220 lb 7.4 oz (100 kg)" />

</description>

<subject>

<reference value="https://hostname/instance/api/FHIR/STU3/Patient/eorzzexPpUZy7OnwQyr9d9-c3VznSBm2hoRThZpECFoc3" />

<display value="Aks Fhir" />

</subject>

<startDate value="2018-04-10" />

<addresses>

<reference value="https://hostname/instance/api/FHIR/STU3/Condition/eApFf4P9A8IhBX6yz6aXOZQ3" />

<display value="Abnormal Weight Gain" />

</addresses>

<note>

<text value="(100 kg)" />

</note>

</Goal>

addresses.Name: addresses
addresses.Description: Issues addressed by this goal. Reference to a Problems resource that this goal addresses.

category.Name: category
category.Description: Based on  the category number by default, with Title and then Synonym as backups. Can use SNOMED if OID is specified and a mapping table has been built by the Epic community member. Ex: treatment, dietary, or behavioral.

description.Name: description
description.Description: What the goal entails. SNOMED code or other text describing the goal.

expressedBy.Name: expressedBy
expressedBy.Description: Who is responsible for creating the goal. "Author" in DSTU2.

startDate.Name: startDate
startDate.Description: When pursuit of the goal begins.

status.Name: status
status.Description:
The current status of the goal. The following values are supported:

  • in-progress
  • achieved
  • cancelled

The status for received document records is always "in-progress."

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: Who the goal is intended for. Patient FHIR Resource ID.
